title: Introduction to basicproperties
text: basicproperties R package calculation set basic statistical properties time-series data. intention used form measurement complex time-series feature sets individual features can compared. ensures complexity added warranted.

title: Introduction to basicproperties
text: Users can compute features basicproperties using main function get_properties. can run one-liner takes input vector argument. demonstration vector \(T = 1000\) samples generated AR(1) process:
code: y <- arima.sim(model = list(ar = 0.8), n = 1000) outs <- get_properties(y) head(outs) #>   feature_name       values  feature_set #> 1         mean  0.078300260 distribution #> 2       median  0.081857965 distribution #> 3         mode           NA distribution #> 4          min -4.583086454 distribution #> 5          max  4.902474410 distribution #> 6     skewness -0.005914857 distribution

title: Introduction to basicproperties
text: basicproperties highly computationally efficient, scaling nearly linearly time-series size. Computation time seconds range time series lengths presented .

code: @Manual{,   title = {basicproperties: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties},   author = {Trent Henderson},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.3},   url = {https://hendersontrent.github.io/basicproperties/}, }

what: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties
title: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties
text: R package calculation set basic statistical properties time-series data.

title: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties
text: can install development version basicproperties GitHub using following:

title: Calculate a Basic Set of Time-Series Properties
text: basicproperties currently calculates 516 features following domains: "distribution"—features ignore temporal ordering compute summary statistics distribution "ACF"—coefficients autocorrelation function lag 5 "linearity"—features associated linear trend time series "quantiles"—values 100 quantiles data "fft"—first 100 coefficients fast Fourier transform, including real, imaginary, absolute, angle components, per tsfresh package Python Users can compute features basicproperties using main function get_properties. can run one-liner takes input vector argument. demonstration vector T = 1000 samples generated AR(1) process: sample twenty features:
code: library(basicproperties) y <- arima.sim(model = list(ar = 0.8), n = 1000) outs <- get_properties(y) feature_name        values  feature_set 1            mean -0.0682273117 distribution 2          median -0.0285242011 distribution 3            mode            NA distribution 4             min -5.3285657460 distribution 5             max  4.5480362786 distribution 6        skewness -0.1532091500 distribution 7        kurtosis -0.2380394101 distribution 8           acf_1  0.8040463790          ACF 9           acf_2  0.6564698047          ACF 10          acf_3  0.5495283435          ACF 11          acf_4  0.4743650582          ACF 12          acf_5  0.3881577375          ACF 13            IQR  2.2607101884 distribution 14             sd  1.6758453734 distribution 15   linear_trend -0.0003344607    linearity 16 prop_above_3SD  0.0010000000 distribution 17     quantile_1 -4.0865978434    quantiles 18     quantile_2 -3.5270973394    quantiles 19     quantile_3 -3.3587224511    quantiles 20     quantile_4 -3.1733633912    quantiles
